article_text:
Presidential candidates are making the late-night rounds this month, with Donald Trump Donald TrumpLibertarian Party eyes 2016 as breakthrough year Clinton urged to go liberal with vice presidential pick Sanders takes different position on superdelegates than he did in 2008 MORE's next one coming Friday night.

The GOP front-runner is poised to appear Friday on NBC’s “The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon."

ADVERTISEMENT

Trump will also sit down with Stephen Colbert for the new “Late Show” host’s Sept. 22 show on CBS. Fellow White House hopeful Sen. Ted Cruz (R-Texas) is slated to guest on the show a night earlier, the network announced this week.

Other commander in chief contenders are also taking a break from the campaign trail to yuck it up on late-night television.

Democrat Hillary Clinton will make a stop at “The Tonight Show” on Sept. 16, while Sen. Bernie Sanders (I-Vt.) is scheduled to appear on Colbert’s show on Sept. 18. Former Maryland Gov. Martin O’Malley (D) is reportedly booked for a Sept. 15 interview on NBC’s “Late Night With Seth Meyers.”

Other commander in chief contenders are also taking a break from the campaign trail to yuck it up on late-night television.
The GOP front-runner is poised to appear Friday on NBC’s “The Tonight Show Starring Jimmy Fallon."

Fellow White House hopeful Sen. Ted Cruz (R-Texas) is slated to guest on the show a night earlier, the network announced this week.
